tool_input.query: Animal Farm first Polish translation 1947 London exile Teresa Jeleńska "Zwierzęcy folwark"

tool_response.query: Animal Farm first Polish translation 1947 London exile Teresa Jeleńska "Zwierzęcy folwark"

content.title: Folwark zwierzęcy Folwark zwierzęcy, Komiks wg Orwella. Animal Farm. Comics After Orwell. | First edition, first issue with price 120 zloty printed on rear cover . Oblong, format A5. Text in Polish

results:
Based on the search results, I found specific information about the first Polish translation of Animal Farm. Here are the key details:

The first Polish edition, translated by Teresa Jeleńska, was published in exile in London in 1947 under the title "Zwierzęcy folwark". This information confirms all the elements mentioned in your search query - it was indeed the first Polish translation, it was done by Teresa Jeleńska, it was published in 1947 in London by Polish exiles, and the Polish title was "Zwierzęcy folwark."

The search results also provide additional context about the work itself, noting that Animal Farm presents farm animals that expelled humans and began ruling the farm themselves, and that it is an allegorical representation of Stalinism and a warning against all totalitarianism.

The translation appeared just two years after the original English version was published in 1945, making it one of the early international translations of Orwell's work.
